intro: Ibarraea petenensis, commonly known as the Petén nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. Its fruits are berries that turn red when mature, containing several seeds. Ibarraea petenensis is often found in dry forests and savannas, thriving in tropical and subtropical climates.
